snippet: The editor of the English-language Jakarta Post said he was “amazed” at the suggestion of blasphemy because the cartoon was meant to criticize deviant Islam.
abstract: Indonesian police summon Meidyatama Suryodiningrat, chief editor of English-language Jakarta Post, for questioning in connection with published cartoon that depicted radical Islamists in Syria.
lead_paragraph: The editor of the English-language Jakarta Post said he was “amazed” at the suggestion of blasphemy because the cartoon was meant to criticize deviant Islam.

headline.main: Indonesian Who Published Anti-ISIS Cartoon Is Summoned Under Blasphemy Law
headline.print_headline: Indonesia: Police Question Editor Over Cartoon in Blasphemy Inquiry

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
